channel.title: CVE Feed for barrykooij -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for barrykooij -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-3506|2024-08-03T01:14:01.581Z -- barrykooij -- barrykooij%2Frelated-posts-for-wp
item.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository barrykooij/related-posts-for-wp prior to 2.1.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-0592|2024-08-01T18:11:35.655Z -- barrykooij -- related%20posts%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Related Posts for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the handle_create_link() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add related posts to other posts via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This ultimately makes it possible for attackers to view draft and password protected posts.

item.title: CVE-2024-0592|2024-06-04T17:58:57.676Z -- barrykooij -- related%20posts%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Related Posts for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the handle_create_link() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add related posts to other posts via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This ultimately makes it possible for attackers to view draft and password protected posts.
